thread.title: Suspect accused of raping and murdering jogger 'told police he strangled her because he was angry'
thread.title_full: Suspect accused of raping and murdering jogger 'told police he strangled her because he was angry'

author: Natalie Evans
title: Suspect accused of raping and murdering jogger 'told police he strangled her because he was angry'
text:
News Suspect accused of raping and murdering jogger 'told police he strangled her because he was angry' Chanel Lewis, 20, was arrested on Saturday after his DNA allegedly tied him to the scene where Karina Vetrano was found dead Share By Natalie Evans Chris kitching 23:01, 6 FEB 2017 Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now New York man to face murder charge in jogger's death Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The man accused of killing a jogger allegedly told police he strangled her because he was "angry", it was reported. 
Chanel Lewis, 20, is suspected of raping and murdering avid runner Karina Vetrano, 30, in New York last August. 
Police believe she was punched in the face before being dragged into the park and sexually assaulted and strangled in the Howard Beach area of Queens. 
Lewis, from Brooklyn, was arrested on Saturday after his DNA allegedly linked him to the scene. Karina Vetrano was murdered while she was jogging (Photo: Facebook) Chanel Lewis is brought out of a police station (Photo: PIX11) 
Prosecutors are preparing to charge him with murder and sexual assault after the necessary papers are prepared, Queens District Attorney Richard Brown said. 
Investigators said they do not believe Lewis and the victim knew each other and had no evidence that Lewis had stalked her, NYPD Chief of Detectives Robert Boyce said. 
"It appears to be a chance encounter," he said. Ms Vetrano was captured on CCTV shortly before she died (Photo: Daily Crime Watch) 
DNA recovered from the victim's body and phone linked him to the crime after he voluntarily submitted a sample last week, the New York Daily News reports. 
The sample allegedly matched DNA found under Ms Vetrano's fingernails. 
Lewis also made "detailed incriminating statements and admissions" to detectives, said NYPD Chief of Detectives Robert Boyce. Read More DNA found under Ms Vetrano's fingernails helped police to make an arrest (Photo: Facebook) The murder victim was described as a keen runner (Photo: Facebook) 
Lewis allegedly told police that he killed Karina because he was in a bad mood, the New York Post reported. 
He reportedly told cops: "I was angry. I had some issues at home. I just lost it. When I saw her, I just hit her and kept hitting her. I hit her and choked her." Parents Phil and Cathy Vetrano speak to reporters (Photo: NY Daily News) 
Ms Vetrano's parents were relieved after learning of the arrest. 
Her mother, Cathy, said: "The demon must get his justice. We will see to it." 
Ms Vetrano's father, Phil, who found her body, added: "I'm not going to say it is a good day but we can move forward now. We know who did this." 
Lewis was unemployed and lived at home with his mother, and was hit with three summonses, dating back to 2013, near the scene of the murder. 
Police focused on him after analysing a 911 call made by someone who said he was acting suspiciously. Read More The 30-year-old and her father, Phil, who found her body (Photo: GoFundMe) A poster that was circulated following the murder (Photo: @NYPDnews/twitter) 
His father, Richard, told the New York Daily News following the arrest: "He's a humble kid. It's extremely surprising...he's not the person for that." 
Haunting images of Ms Vetrano's last moments were caught on CCTV before she was abducted. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
